newsitem.title: TAIWAN: TAIWAN UMAX JULY SALES SOAR 134 PCT.
newsitem.headline: TAIWAN UMAX JULY SALES SOAR 134 PCT.

text.p: Taiwan manufacturer Umax Data Systems Inc said on Saturday its July sales revenue jumped 134 percent to T$1.13 billion from July 1996.
The company said in a statement that the revenue growth was due to increasing sales of its scanners and computers.
The firm's combined January-July sales totalled T$7.71 billion, up 182 percent from the same period a year ago.
The statement did not give profit figures.
Umax, which would begin producing notebook computers from the fourth quarter, said the company's business was expected to benefit from Intel Corp's recent price cut.
"We are optimitsic about the company's outlook," the statement said.
Intel slashed prices on its best selling computer chips in July.
Umax and its U.S. unit Umax Computer Corp are among several Asian manufacturers licensed to design and make Mac-compatible "clones" that run on Apple's popular Mac OS operation system.
Umax has set a 1997 pre-tax profit of T$1.46 billion on sales of T$15.344 billion.
